page.title: 13THRESHFIELD PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: {Threshfield Primary School}was built in{1674}and was founded by the {Reverend Matthew Hewitt.}It was originally built as a{Free Grammar {School}to house boarders from the {Linton}and{Threshfield area.}It ceased to be such in the 18th Century and is now a{Primary School.}The building itself is{'listed'}and so alterations to the exterior are not permitted, however, the interior has indergone considerable change primarily by having had the{second floor(the {original dormitories)}removed.The school now houses two classes of children,{Infants}and{Juniors,}taught by the{Headmaster}and his assistant. The school offers tuition in{Maths, {Language Development,Environmental {Work, Art and Craft}and{Physical {Education.}It is one of a number of small schools and has fifty children.
